com.codename1.webrtc

Interface MediaStreamTrack

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EventTarget, RefCounted

    public interface MediaStreamTrack
extends RefCounted, EventTarget

    The MediaStreamTrack interface represents a single media track within a stream; typically, these are audio or video tracks, but other track types may exist as well.

    See Also:
    https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  MediaStreamTrack.ReadyState
      Status enum to record the state of a MediaStreamTrack

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      RTCPromise applyConstraints(MediaTrackConstraints constraints)
      Lets the application specify the ideal and/or ranges of acceptable values for any number of the available constrainable properties of the MediaStreamTrack.
      MediaStreamTrack clone()
      Returns a duplicate of the MediaStreamTrack.
      MediaTrackConstraints getConstraints()
      Returns a MediaTrackConstraints object containing the currently set constraints for the track; the returned value matches the constraints last set using applyConstraints().
      String getContentHint()
      A string that may be used by the web application to provide a hint as to what type of content the track contains to guide how it should be treated by API consumers.
      String getId()
      Returns a DOMString containing a unique identifier (GUID) for the track; it is generated by the browser.
      TrackKind getKind()
      Returns a DOMString set to "audio" if the track is an audio track and to "video", if it is a video track.
      String getLabel()
      Returns a DOMString containing a user agent-assigned label that identifies the track source, as in "internal microphone".
      MediaStreamTrack.ReadyState getReadyState()
      Returns an enumerated value giving the status of the track.
      MediaTrackSettings getSettings()
      Returns a MediaTrackSettings object containing the current values of each of the MediaStreamTrack’s constrainable properties.
      boolean isEnabled()
      A Boolean whose value of true if the track is enabled, that is allowed to render the media source stream; or false if it is disabled, that is not rendering the media source stream but silence and blackness.
      boolean isMuted()
      Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the track is unable to provide media data due to a technical issue.
      boolean isReadOnly()
      Returns a Boolean value with a value of true if the track is readonly (such a video file source or a camera that settings can’t be modified), false otherwise.
      boolean isRemote()
      Returns a Boolean with a value of true if the track is sourced by a RTCPeerConnection, false otherwise.
      void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
      A Boolean whose value of true if the track is enabled, that is allowed to render the media source stream; or false if it is disabled, that is not rendering the media source stream but silence and blackness.
      void stop()
      Stops playing the source associated to the track, both the source and the track are deassociated.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.codename1.webrtc.RefCounted

        release, retain

      • Methods inherited from interface com.codename1.webrtc.EventTarget

        addEventListener, dispatchEvent, removeEventListener

    • Method Detail

      • getContentHint

        String getContentHint()

        A string that may be used by the web application to provide a hint as to what type of content the track contains to guide how it should be treated by API consumers.

        Returns:

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()

        A Boolean whose value of true if the track is enabled, that is allowed to render the media source stream; or false if it is disabled, that is not rendering the media source stream but silence and blackness. If the track has been disconnected, this value can be changed but has no more effect.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/enabled

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled(boolean enabled)

        A Boolean whose value of true if the track is enabled, that is allowed to render the media source stream; or false if it is disabled, that is not rendering the media source stream but silence and blackness. If the track has been disconnected, this value can be changed but has no more effect.

        Parameters:
        enabled -
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/enabled

      • getId

        String getId()

        Returns a DOMString containing a unique identifier (GUID) for the track; it is generated by the browser.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/id

      • getKind

        TrackKind getKind()

        Returns a DOMString set to "audio" if the track is an audio track and to "video", if it is a video track. It doesn’t change if the track is deassociated from its source.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/kind

      • getLabel

        String getLabel()

        Returns a DOMString containing a user agent-assigned label that identifies the track source, as in "internal microphone". The string may be left empty and is empty as long as no source has been connected. When the track is deassociated from its source, the label is not changed.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/label

      • isMuted

        boolean isMuted()

        Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the track is unable to provide media data due to a technical issue.

        Returns:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/muted

      • isReadOnly

        boolean isReadOnly()

        Returns a Boolean value with a value of true if the track is readonly (such a video file source or a camera that settings can’t be modified), false otherwise.

        Returns:

      • getReadyState

        MediaStreamTrack.ReadyState getReadyState()

        Returns an enumerated value giving the status of the track. This will be one of the following values: . "live" which indicates that an input is connected and does its best-effort in providing real-time data. In that case, the output of data can be switched on or off using the enabled attribute. . "ended" which indicates that the input is not giving any more data and will never provide new data.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/readyState

      • isRemote

        boolean isRemote()

        Returns a Boolean with a value of true if the track is sourced by a RTCPeerConnection, false otherwise.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/remote

      • applyConstraints

        RTCPromise applyConstraints(MediaTrackConstraints constraints)

        Lets the application specify the ideal and/or ranges of acceptable values for any number of the available constrainable properties of the MediaStreamTrack.

        Parameters:
        constraints -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/applyConstraints

      • clone

        MediaStreamTrack clone()

        Returns a duplicate of the MediaStreamTrack.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/clone

      • getConstraints

        MediaTrackConstraints getConstraints()

        Returns a MediaTrackConstraints object containing the currently set constraints for the track; the returned value matches the constraints last set using applyConstraints().

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/getConstraints

      • getSettings

        MediaTrackSettings getSettings()

        Returns a MediaTrackSettings object containing the current values of each of the MediaStreamTrack’s constrainable properties.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/getSettings

      • stop

        void stop()

        Stops playing the source associated to the track, both the source and the track are deassociated. The track state is set to ended.

        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/stop
